title: Carrie Ann Inaba hilariously FALLS after she misses her chair on Dancing With The Stars
text:
Carrie Ann Inaba fell off her chair on Monday's edition of Dancing with the Stars.

The 51-year-old TV personality had just praised the tandem of actress Kate Flannery and dance pro Pasha Pashkov for their rendition of A Spoonful of Sugar from Mary Poppins on the show's Disney-themed episode.

The Dancing with the Stars judge gave the pair 24 out of 30 possible points for their dance exhibition, calling it 'so well-rehearsed' and saying they were 'so in sync' on the floor.

Oops! Carrie Ann Inaba, 51, fell on Monday's edition of Dancing with the Stars.

Hold your head high: She was in good spirits about the on camera flub, laughing at the slip

At that point, the Honolulu, Hawaii native fell rose to take a gander at a prop left over from the dance routine - but she did not catch the chair as she made her way down, falling onto the ground.

She was in good spirits about the on camera flub, laughing at the slip while her colleagues Len Goodman and Bruno Tonioli appeared shocked by the mistake. Flannery and Pashkov, as well as staffers on the network program, rushed in to check on her, and she was alright, saying, 'It was a slip!'

Host Tom Bergeron commented, 'Are you alright? I knew those chairs were gonna be trouble!'

A number of fans took to Twitter to comment on the incident, in which Carrie Ann was thankfully unscathed.

Stalwart: Inaba is a staple of the judges' panel with Len Gooodman (center) and Bruno Tonioli

Recuperating: Inaba's colleagues Len Goodman and Bruno Tonioli appeared shocked by the mistake

Whoops: Carrie fell to the ground but was in good spirits as she had a huge smile on her face

Panic: The judges and Kate even rushed to her aid

'I know the episode isn’t over yet but my favorite part of the entire show is @carrieanninaba falling out of her chair,' one fan wrote, while another said, 'Carrie Ann Inaba just fell off her chair on dancing with the stars...HARD. This is why I tune in people!'

Inaba previously took a tumble on an episode of the series seven years ago when actor Gilles Marini and his pro partner Peta Murgatroyd turned in a rumba that impressed her.

She said, 'Let the baby-making begin,' before hitting the ground, later showing her moxie in saying, 'You know what, I'll take a fall any time like that.'

Dancing with the Stars can be seen on ABC Mondays at 8/7c.

Moving: Carrie Ann had just praised the tandem of actress Kate Flannery and dance pro Pasha Pashkov for their rendition of A Spoonful of Sugar from Mary Poppins on the show's Disney-themed episode
description: The Honolulu, Hawaii native fell rose to take a gander at a prop left over from the dance routine - but she did not catch the chair as she made her way down, falling onto the ground.
